intro: Saurauia conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's everlet, is a rare and endangered shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist, and shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is critically endangered and requires specialized care in cultivation.
